intro: Eryngium vesiculosum var. minor, commonly known as the lesser thimbleweed, is a herbaceous perennial native to North America. It features spiky, blue to purple flower heads surrounded by bracts that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has hairy, narrow leaves. It thrives in moist to wet soils and is often found in marshy areas or along stream banks. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a valuable addition to wetland ecosystems.
